answers.answer: Hi, its unlikely that the cramping at the back is due to stomach issues. It could be due to other cause like cervical spondylosis. Some metabolic disorders like diabetes mellitus and thyroid disorders are known to simulate these symptoms. Please consult your primary care physician who will carry out blood tests and x rays to rule out these conditions. Regards.

question: I have this spot the size of my palm 2 finger widths below my left shoulder blade on the spine side of my back.  Could this be due to stomach issues.  They said I may have gastritis or gerd.  I have alot of bloating and belching.  Everytime I sit on my couch I get this cramping feeling in this spot.  Any ideas?
title: Back cramping - stomach issues
